title: Colonial America and Early Settlement

vocab.definition: A settlement in a new land that is controlled by another country
Religious settlers who came to America on the Mayflower in 1620
The first permanent English settlement in America, founded in 1607
An agreement made by the Pilgrims to govern themselves fairly
A person who lives in a colony

teachingNotes: Focus on the reasons people came to America and the challenges they faced. Emphasize the importance of cooperation in early settlements.

sample.question: What was the first permanent English settlement in America?

truefalse.question: The Pilgrims came to America seeking religious freedom.

multiplechoice.question: What ship brought the Pilgrims to America?

fillintheblank.question: The ________ was an agreement made by the Pilgrims to govern themselves.

shortanswer.question: Why did many people come to the American colonies?
